title: 109_hr3988
content: The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita, requiring a minimum percentage of contracts to be awarded to small businesses. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that a certain percentage of contracts related to Hurricane Katrina and Rita must be awarded to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas, with a focus on providing opportunities for small businesses participation and ensuring compliance with subcontracting goals. The Federal department or agency must provide opportunities for small businesses participation and ensure compliance with subcontracting goals under the Small Business Act and Federal Acquisition Regulations. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress within 2 years of the enactment of this Act. This subsection will terminate one day after all Federal contracts are completed. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress on opportunities for small businesses under this Act. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act purposes. SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No federal facility can be permanently moved from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. This prohibition will end two years after the enactment of this Act. Reports are required for facilities temporarily relocated for over 6 months. The reports required for facilities temporarily relocated from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas include a status report to be submitted within 6 months of relocation and additional reports every 6 months thereafter for the duration of the temporary relocation period. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small business concern" as a small business located in a Gulf hurricane-affected area as of August 28, 2005. It also defines "Gulf hurricane disaster" as an event caused by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita declared a major disaster by the President. Additionally, it defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" as a county or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita. The term "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" in the Act refers to counties or parishes in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita. The term "small business concern" is defined as per the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be in effect 10 days after its enactment.
